property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={13, 80, 1070, 632}, maximized=false}

property.name: runCommand
property.value: node nodeHostInvoke.js node_modules/@accessors-hosts/node/@modelName@

property.name: text
property.value:
This model implements a Heartbeat that phones home to a mothership website.
The mothership portion is not present and this model requires a non-public key in $HOME/.ptKeystore/heartbeatKey
If you have access to the TerraSwarm swarmbox repo, then get the key from swarmbox/heartbeat/key
See https://www.terraswarm.org/testbeds/wiki/Main/SwarmboxGitRepo
To download the repo using a repo.eecs.berkeley.edu username and password (possibly different than your terraswarm website username and password): git clone https://repo.eecs.berkeley.edu/git/projects/terraswarm/swarmbox.git If you uploaded your SSH key to repo.eecs, then use: git clone repoman@repo.eecs.berkeley.edu:projects/terraswarm/swarmbox.git

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
Send a heartbeat to a mothership monitoring web server.

This accessor is not of much use because it requires the Mothership server, which is not yet available.

The Mothership server require a key string from the Heartbeat client.

This accessor looks for key in $KEYSTORE/heartbeatKey, which resolves to $HOME/.ptKeystore/heartbeatKey.

The key is found in the swarmbox git repo, which not public. Look for swarmbox/heartbeat/key See https://www.terraswarm.org/testbeds/wiki/Main/SwarmboxGitRepo

To download the repo using a repo.eecs.berkeley.edu username and password (possibly different than your terraswarm website username and password):

git clone https://repo.eecs.berkeley.edu/git/projects/terraswarm/swarmbox.git

If you uploaded your SSH key to repo.eecs, then use:

git clone repoman@repo.eecs.berkeley.edu:projects/terraswarm/swarmbox.git

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks, based on heartbeat.js by Marten Lohstroh.

property.name: ipAddress (port)
property.value: The IP address of the host

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: This accessor outputs the IP address of the local machine.

property.name: author
property.value: Elizabeth Latronico (beth@berkeley.edu), based on IPAddress actor by Christopher Brooks

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: Send a token here to produce an output.

property.name: IPAddress (port)
property.value: The IP address of the local machine.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: interval (parameter)
property.value: The interval between outputs in milliseconds.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: Output for the counting sequence, of type number.
